thread.title: Atlanta police: Video may be key to identifying bandits
thread.title_full: Atlanta police: Video may be key to identifying bandits | www.ajc.com

author: Steve Visser
title: Atlanta police: Video may be key to identifying bandits
text:
Armed robbers hit three Atlanta gas stations in a two-hour span this week and at least one was caught vividly on a video that police released Friday.
If that doesnâ€™t lead to an arrest, police hope that a series of still photos and a shot of sneakers might trigger recognition by someone who knows the gunmen.
The robberies happened between 10:45 p.m. Wednesday and 12:30 a.m. Thursday, Officer Kim Jones said. Detectives believe that the sames bandits robbed the Chevron at 3040 Headland Dr., the Texaco at 608 14th St. and the Exxon at 1521 Peachtree St., Jones said.
Atlanta police believe this man and his cohorts are responsible for three robberies this week. (Surveillance) Anyone with information is urged to contact the investigating detective at 404-546-2498 or email mbuckley@atlantaga.gov, Jones said. They are eligible for a reward up to $2,000 if the tip leads to a conviction.
Any information on the case can be submitted anonymously to the Crime Stoppers Atlanta tip line at 404-577-TIPS (8477), online at www.crimestoppersatlanta.org or by texting CSA and the tip to CRIMES (274637).
Police hope that this man is still recognizable despite the head covering. (Surveillance) Atlanta police need help identifying this young man, who is wanted for three robberies this week. (Surveillance) Police hope that these shoes might help someone recognize the partially obscured faces of the gas station robbery suspects. (Surveillance)
